translated: Because of being empty of self and other, it is empty.

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de nyid las bzlog par bya ba de gnyis ni dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de nyid las bzlog par bya ba de gnyis ni dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Those two, which are to be reversed from that permanence, etc., are to be rejected and accepted.

original: gtso bo'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: Because of being primary, the truth of suffering is grasped.

original: de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin stong zhes bya ba 'dis ni rab tu 'byed pa'i stobs kyis lhag ma bden pa gsum po'i phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa de gnyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin stong zhes bya ba 'dis ni rab tu 'byed pa'i stobs kyis lhag ma bden pa gsum po'i phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa de gnyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This suchness and emptiness includes the remaining three truths, which are the discordant side and the antidote side, by the power of analysis.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas ji ltar goms par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas ji ltar goms par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the bodhisattva cultivate?

original: stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The emptiness of that, etc. is stated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag des mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag des mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend those forms, etc. by that.

original: 'dir rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi gnyen po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas des mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dus ji srid
analyzed: 'dir rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi gnyen po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bden pa bzhi'i dngos po la dmigs pa nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas des mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dus ji srid
translated: Here, the ≈õrƒÅvaka generates the path of seeing by the objective support of the four truths with aspects such as impermanence, which are the antidote to the dharmas such as permanence. By that seeing, he abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing. For how long?

original: sgom pa gang zhig shes pas phyis lam der ltung bar dogs nas spang ba'i phyir rnam pa de dag mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yid la byed do //üîΩde bas na stong pa @21a * //
analyzed: sgom pa gang zhig shes pas phyis lam der ltung bar dogs nas spang ba'i phyir rnam pa de dag mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yid la byed do // de bas na stong pa @21a * //
translated: The meditation is the mental attention to the nature of the non-apprehension of those aspects, in order to avoid falling into that path later on, through the knowledge of which one would abandon it.

original: nyid kyi bden pas spyir 'bras bu cung zad gang thob pa la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: nyid kyi bden pas spyir 'bras bu cung zad gang thob pa la yang mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, by the truth of emptiness, one does not abide in any result whatsoever that is attained in general.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po rtul po dang 'bring dang rnon po la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin byang chub rnam pa gsum thob ces nyan thos kyi theg pa las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po rtul po dang 'bring dang rnon po la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin byang chub rnam pa gsum thob ces nyan thos kyi theg pa las bstan pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle it is taught that when one cultivates the aspects such as impermanence in relation to dull, middling, and sharp faculties, one attains the three types of enlightenment in the appropriate order.

original: khyad par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar mi gnas shing rnam pa thams cad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa bstan pa'i rim pas thabs ma yin pa'i phyir des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i ched du bdag med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spongüîΩdu 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar mi gnas shing rnam pa thams cad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa bstan pa'i rim pas thabs ma yin pa'i phyir des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i ched du bdag med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong du 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It causes them to enter into the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions by way of selflessness.

original: de las byang chub sems dpas kyang rgyal ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de las byang chub sems dpas kyang rgyal ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, bodhisattvas enter into the victor‚Äôs vehicle.

original: bden pa yongs su shes pa'i sngon du nges par 'byed pa'i cha yongs su shes pa 'gro bas nges par 'byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa yongs su shes pa'i sngon du nges par 'byed pa'i cha yongs su shes pa 'gro bas nges par 'byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the ascertainment, prior to the full understanding of the truth,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dren pa bcom ldan 'das gnas pa med par spyod pa de ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi de kho na nyid la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dren pa bcom ldan 'das gnas pa med par spyod pa de ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi de kho na nyid la yang mi gnas so //
translated: Just as the Lord, the Guide, does not abide in the unconditioned, so also he does not abide in the reality of the unconditioned element, such as thusness, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i 'dus byas la yang mi gnas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i 'dus byas la yang mi gnas shing /
translated: Similarly, he does not abide in the conditioned element, such as the desire realm, etc.

original: de bas na de la ji ltar snang ba rnams la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la ji ltar snang ba rnams la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he abides in the way things appear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas nges par 'byed pa yongs su shes pa gnas kyang byang chub sems dpa' gnas med pa nyid gnas yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas nges par 'byed pa yongs su shes pa gnas kyang byang chub sems dpa' gnas med pa nyid gnas yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the bodhisattva, who has the knowledge of the penetrating insight that is cultivated in the way that has been taught, abides in the absence of any abode.

original: gang gi phyir gnas med gnas yin 'di ni rgyal ba de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas med gnas yin 'di ni rgyal ba de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, the Victor, the TathƒÅgata, has said that the absence of abode is the abode.

original: nyan thos kyi lam gyi rjes la rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam brjod par rigs mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam gyi rjes la rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lam brjod par rigs mod kyi /
translated: It is reasonable to explain the path of the pratyekabuddhas after the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: nyan thos las rang sangs rgyas ji ltar khyad par du 'phags /
analyzed: nyan thos las rang sangs rgyas ji ltar khyad par du 'phags /
translated: But how is the pratyekabuddha superior to the ≈õrƒÅvaka?

original: gang gis na de nyid kyi lam la khyad par gyi ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gang gis sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dus byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos pa med par rang gi byang chub thob pa ni gcig yin
analyzed: gang gis na de nyid kyi lam la khyad par gyi ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gang gis sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dus byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos pa med par rang gi byang chub thob pa ni gcig yin
translated: In order to dispel the qualm ‚ÄúWhat is the difference in the path itself?‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúOne is the one who, due to having previously cultivated listening and so on, attains enlightenment by oneself without relying on the teachings of another.‚Äù

original: no // de bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / sgra brjod pa med par gzhan gyi don @21b byed pa dag gis ye shes zab pa yin te /
analyzed: no // de bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa dang / sgra brjod pa med par gzhan gyi don @21b byed pa dag gis ye shes zab pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, due to the elimination of one aspect of the obscuration to omniscience, the conception of the apprehended, and due to the performance of the purpose of others without verbal expression, the wisdom is profound.

original: gnyis kyi khyad par du 'phags so //üîΩgzhan du na khyad par du 'phags pa med na lam la khyad par yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi khyad par du 'phags so // gzhan du na khyad par du 'phags pa med na lam la khyad par yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is superior to the two.üîΩOtherwise, if there were no superiority, it would not be reasonable for the path to be superior. Therefore, it should be understood that this is an indirect reference.

original: de bas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam khyad par can rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bstan pa'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam khyad par can rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bstan pa'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the special path that is superior, ‚Äúthose who‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig rgya mtshor nub pas pha rol dang tshu rol gyi 'gram mi mthong bas 'gro bar mi nus te /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig rgya mtshor nub pas pha rol dang tshu rol gyi 'gram mi mthong bas 'gro bar mi nus te /
translated: For example, someone who is drowning in the ocean does not see the near shore or the far shore and is unable to go anywhere.

original: thabs mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not know the means.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa'i skye bos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa'i skye bos so //
translated: In the same way, beings who are drowning in the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir bde gshegs ni nyan thos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir bde gshegs ni nyan thos so //
translated: Because of not turning back, the Well-Gone is the Hearer.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin chos rgyal 'gyur 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin chos rgyal 'gyur 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who wishes to become a Self-Buddha and a Dharma King is the one who aspires.

original: des na 'di la ni lam shes pa ste lam thams cad du yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'di la ni lam shes pa ste lam thams cad du yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in this case, it is the Path Knowledge, because it is the object of all paths.

original: chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa 'di la ma brten par sangs rgyas thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa 'di la ma brten par sangs rgyas thob par mi nus te /
translated: Without relying on this acceptance of the realization of the Dharma, it is not possible to attain Buddhahood.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi thob ces bya ba'i don te gzhan du 'thob pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi thob ces bya ba'i don te gzhan du 'thob pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the desired goal is not attained, the meaning is that it is not attained elsewhere.

original: 'dis gzhi khyab pa'i don du bstan pa 'dis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa de bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis gzhi khyab pa'i don du bstan pa 'dis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa de bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows the meaning of universal basis. This shows the path of the pratyekabuddha from the point of view of the path.

original: gzung bar rtog pa 'ba' zhig sngangs pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang gis khyad par du 'phags pa de'i rang bzhin kho na lam shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa 'ba' zhig sngangs pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang gis khyad par du 'phags pa de'i rang bzhin kho na lam shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha is superior by virtue of the fact that it is frightened by the mere conception of the object. Its nature is not just the knowledge of the path,

original: 'on kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yang yin no //
translated: but also the nature of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and so on.

original: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that without an object there is no subject.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci 'dra bas chos 'dzin pa rang sangs rgyas su rtogs sha na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci 'dra bas chos 'dzin pa rang sangs rgyas su rtogs sha na /
translated: What is the kind of conception of the subject by virtue of which the apprehension of phenomena is understood as the pratyekabuddha?

original: chos 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúThe explanation of the Dharma, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir chos 'chad pa dang nyan dang bshad bya gang yin pa sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chos 'chad pa dang nyan dang bshad bya gang yin pa sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
translated: Here, the explanation of the Dharma, the listener, and the one who explains are like an illusion.

original: 'dir dgos pa ni de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos te ;
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa ni de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos te ;
translated: Here, the purpose is the Dharma of such things.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid dngos po'i bdag rgyur rung bas 'dzin par byed par rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'bras bu skye bas de med na med pa yin mod kyi /üîΩgzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa na yang gzugs la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i rnam @22a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid dngos po'i bdag rgyur rung bas 'dzin par byed par rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'bras bu skye bas de med na med pa yin mod kyi / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa na yang gzugs la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i rnam @22a * //
translated: Because the nonconceptual consciousness that apprehends the cause of the entity of its own characteristics is indeed the effect of the arising of its own characteristics.üîΩBut when the conception of the object is stopped, the conception of the subject that is the consciousness apprehending form and so on is not stopped because it arises from the arousing of imprints in the mindstream.

original: par rtog pa'i shes pas rang gi rgyud la bag chags gzhag pa sad pa las skye ba'i phyir bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las nges 'byung zhes bya ba'i nges pa med do //
analyzed: par rtog pa'i shes pas rang gi rgyud la bag chags gzhag pa sad pa las skye ba'i phyir bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las nges 'byung zhes bya ba'i nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no certainty that the conception of the object definitely arises from the conception of the object.

original: gang gi phyir rang sangs rgyas gang gis gzhan la 'chad pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'chad pa yang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang sangs rgyas gang gis gzhan la 'chad pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'chad pa yang ste /
translated: Because pratyekabuddhas do not teach others, they are not teachers.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog pas bzung ba'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes pa nyan pa dang 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog pas bzung ba'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes pa nyan pa dang 'dzin par byed de /
translated: After they apprehend form and so on with nonconceptual consciousness, they are called those who listen and apprehend the conception of the subject.

original: de bzhin du gang mnyan pa dang ldan pa dag nyan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang mnyan pa dang ldan pa dag nyan pa ste /
translated: Likewise, those who listen to the Dharma are listeners.

original: de dag thams cad kyang rdzun pa snang ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i chos 'dzin pa'ang sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rdzun pa snang ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i chos 'dzin pa'ang sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: All of them are holders of the Dharma free from the conceptualization that grasps the nature of the false appearance of things.

original: chos de 'chad pa dang nyan pa yang sgyu ma lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos de 'chad pa dang nyan pa yang sgyu ma lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of that Dharma and the listening to it should be understood as being like an illusion.

original: de bas na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i rigs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i rigs pa /
translated: Therefore, this reasoning, which does not eliminate the conceptualization of grasping,

original: 'dis yang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi rang bzhin du gyur par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dis yang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi rang bzhin du gyur par blta'o //
translated: should be seen as the nature of the path of the pratyekabuddhas.üîΩBy what aspect is the Dharma taught as being like an illusion?

original: rnam pa gang gis chos sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa ni rang bzhin bkag nas de kho na nyid du yod par rtogs zhes zer na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis chos sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa ni rang bzhin bkag nas de kho na nyid du yod par rtogs zhes zer na /
translated: If one says that it is taught in order to realize the existence of reality by negating intrinsic nature,

original: 'bras bu thob ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúThe attainment of the fruit, etc.‚Äù

original: de la 'bras bu gang zhig dang po la sogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag brgyad po ni 'bras bu 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gang zhig dang po la sogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag brgyad po ni 'bras bu 'thob pa'o //
translated: Therein, the attainment of the fruit is the attainment of the fruit by the eight persons who abide in the stages of the first fruit, etc.

original: tshogs na spyod pa dang / bse ru lta bu 'ang rang sangs rgyas su mtshungs pas rkyen rgyal lo //
analyzed: tshogs na spyod pa dang / bse ru lta bu 'ang rang sangs rgyas su mtshungs pas rkyen rgyal lo //
translated: The assembly-practitioners and the rhinoceros-like are similar in being self-enlightened buddhas, so they are the condition of the victor.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis po dag gis 'jig rten mgon gyi dbye ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis po dag gis 'jig rten mgon gyi dbye ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The two, the enjoyment body and the emanation body, are the two types of division of the protector of the world.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du don du sbyor bas mkhas pa dang gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du don du sbyor bas mkhas pa dang gsal ba ste /
translated: They are skilled and clear, respectively, because they are applied to the benefit.

original: phul du byung ba'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pas mkhas gsal te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon sum du byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pas mkhas gsal te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon sum du byas pa bzhin no //
translated: They are skilled and clear because they are endowed with the highest wisdom, just like the perfect Buddha who is directly perceived.

original: yang gang gis chos kyi sku thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: yang gang gis chos kyi sku thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the attainment of the dharma body is nirvana.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba ni mkhas rig go //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba ni mkhas rig go //
translated: They are skilled and clear because they are applied to the benefit of self and others, respectively.

original: yang na mkhas pa rnams kyi nang nas shes rab phul tu byung ba phun sum tshogs pa ni mkhas rig go //
analyzed: yang na mkhas pa rnams kyi nang nas shes rab phul tu byung ba phun sum tshogs pa ni mkhas rig go //
translated: Alternatively, they are skilled and clear because they are endowed with the highest wisdom among the skilled.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du byed pa de dag thams cad ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun rdzob tu blang bar bya ba gnyen po sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin @22b yin te ;
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du byed pa de dag thams cad ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun rdzob tu blang bar bya ba gnyen po sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin @22b yin te ;
translated: All of those who actualize perfect complete buddhahood are the nature of the illusion-like antidotes that the yogi/nƒ´ who was just taught should take up conventionally.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal po yang sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par bya ba yin na gzhan lta ci smos te de bzhin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal po yang sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par bya ba yin na gzhan lta ci smos te de bzhin no //
translated: Because they are taught by the reasons of dependent arising and so forth, the Dharma King is to be understood as illusion-like, not to mention others.

original: gang gi brda cung zad grub pas don ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu bstan pas de'i tshe yang nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gi brda cung zad grub pas don ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu bstan pas de'i tshe yang nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: When the example of the illusion is taught to establish the meaning that is not established by the slight establishment of the convention, at that time there is not the slightest fault.

original: ci 'dra ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i snod du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i snod du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the type of person who is a suitable vessel for the vehicle of the Solitary Realizers,

original: gang zag bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zag bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de bas na ming btags pa yin par shes nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgoms pas gang zhig mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i dngos po de ma thag pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ming btags pa yin par shes nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgoms pas gang zhig mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i dngos po de ma thag pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, knowing that it is a mere designation, one perfects the abandonment of the object to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the power of the uninterrupted path, by cultivating the aspect of selflessness.

original: thob par bya ba'i dngos po thob pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis yin te /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i dngos po thob pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis yin te /
translated: The attainment of the object to be attained is by the power of the path of liberation.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs par 'gro zhing @24b 'du shes dang bral ba thob pa de nyid kyi phyir dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba mngon sum du byas nas pha rol tu phyin te /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs par 'gro zhing @24b 'du shes dang bral ba thob pa de nyid kyi phyir dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba mngon sum du byas nas pha rol tu phyin te /
translated: Because of that very fact, one goes to the perfection of exalted wisdom and attains freedom from discriminations.

original: rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam la gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan phyin ci log gi rang bzhin la mi rten to //
analyzed: rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam la gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan phyin ci log gi rang bzhin la mi rten to //
translated: The perfection of realizing the nature of things without error is here the perfection of the path of seeing, not the perfection of the nature of error.

original: don dam par bsgom pa rgyu dang bcas pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par bsgom pa rgyu dang bcas pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of error exists because the ultimate exists with its cause,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the reply is ‚ÄúIf the Blessed One, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te yod pa yin no zhes yod pa'i sgra yongs su bsgrags kyang gtso bos kyang mi spyod na ;
analyzed: gal te gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te yod pa yin no zhes yod pa'i sgra yongs su bsgrags kyang gtso bos kyang mi spyod na ;
translated: If the Blessed One were to exist for as many aeons as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, and the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù were to be proclaimed, still the Lord would not be engaged in existence.

original: skye bo'i tshogs gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du yod do zhes bya bar spyod pa lta ga la yod de yod mi srid pas rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir gzod ma nas nyes pa med pas shin tu dag pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du yod do zhes bya bar spyod pa lta ga la yod de yod mi srid pas rgyu med pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir gzod ma nas nyes pa med pas shin tu dag pa yin no //
translated: How could there be any other group of people who would act in the same way? Since it is impossible, it is free from the faults of causelessness, and so on. Therefore, it is pure from the beginning, free from faults.

original: gzhan gang las rgyur gyur pa de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir yod pa skye bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gang las rgyur gyur pa de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir yod pa skye bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be the arising of an existent, since there is no valid cognition that establishes it as a cause?

original: de bas na dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngar ji skad bstan pa de ltar shes rab pha rol phyin mchog ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba phyin ci log gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngar ji skad bstan pa de ltar shes rab pha rol phyin mchog ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the so-called existent thing is the nature of error. As previously explained, the perfection of wisdom is like that. It is the nature of the path of seeing.

original: spyod pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa gcig pa'i chos thams cad khyad par dang bral ba la rjes su gnas shing rtogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa gcig pa'i chos thams cad khyad par dang bral ba la rjes su gnas shing rtogs so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Practice is to abide in and realize all phenomena, which are of the single aspect of selflessness, free from distinctions.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam bsgom pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur zhes nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam bsgom pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur zhes nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: The summary is for the purpose of showing that the cultivation of the path of seeing is the attainment of the prophecy of the Tathagata of the past.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa mchog dang ni ji skad bstan pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bsgom pas rtogs pa thob pa de'i tshe nga lung bstan par gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa mchog dang ni ji skad bstan pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin bsgom pas rtogs pa thob pa de'i tshe nga lung bstan par gyur te /
translated: When one attains realization through the cultivation of the supreme perfections and the path as taught, at that time one receives the prophecy.

original: sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad kyis dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas na khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad kyis dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas na khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The former Bhagavat Dipankara said, ‚ÄúYou will become a Buddha in the future because you have realized all things as they are.‚Äù

original: phan pa dang bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir mthun par smra bar gyur par rgyal bas gsungs so //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir mthun par smra bar gyur par rgyal bas gsungs so //
translated: The Victorious One has said that one becomes a proponent of what is beneficial and pleasant.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i lam sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas lam shes pa nyid logs shig tu @25a * //üîΩrnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i lam sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas lam shes pa nyid logs shig tu @25a * // rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The path of seeing, etc., which is taught as the knowledge of paths, is set forth separately by the reasoning taught previously in the section on the path of seeing, etc., which is taught as the knowledge of paths.

original: der bstan pa'i nges par 'byed pa mthong ba'i lam 'di'i yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: der bstan pa'i nges par 'byed pa mthong ba'i lam 'di'i yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The ascertainment taught there should be taken as that of the path of seeing.

original: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las brgya byin gyi le'u ste gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las brgya byin gyi le'u ste gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the second chapter of the Verse Summary of the Precious Qualities.

original: // / mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: // / mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi /

original: brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la gzhol bas gdul bya 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la gzhol bas gdul bya 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan te /
translated: it is taught in order to engage disciples in the result by means of a small amount of text and by means of the result.

original: shin tu rnam par bsgom pa'i lam gtso bo yin pas de byed pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par bsgom pa'i lam gtso bo yin pas de byed pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the path that is the principal path of meditation,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gang la ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gang la ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the nature of the path of meditation.

original: de'i bdag nyid la sbyor zhing gnas pas 'gro ba skyob pa ni mgon po ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la sbyor zhing gnas pas 'gro ba skyob pa ni mgon po ste /
translated: The protector is the lord who applies himself to and abides in that nature, and who protects migrating beings.

original: 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas such as Manjushri.

original: 'di la gang zhig rtag tu ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig rtag tu ni thams cad du'o //
translated: Here, one who is always, in every way,

original: gzhung dang don 'dzin pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ni chub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung dang don 'dzin pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ni chub par byed pa'o //
translated: is one who holds the scriptures and their meaning, and who is endowed with the wisdom of hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: chos nyid 'jig par byed pas dngos por mngon par zhen par byed pa ni drug go //
analyzed: chos nyid 'jig par byed pas dngos por mngon par zhen par byed pa ni drug go //
translated: The six are the causes of the destruction of reality, and they cause one to cling to things as real.

original: sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni me'o //
analyzed: sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni me'o //
translated: Desire is fire, because it has the nature of burning.

original: zug rngu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshon ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: zug rngu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshon ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: A weapon is hatred, because it has the nature of piercing.

original: gti mug gis grang ba dang dro ba med par byed pas chu'o //
analyzed: gti mug gis grang ba dang dro ba med par byed pas chu'o //
translated: Water is delusion, because delusion causes one to be neither hot nor cold.

original: mi tshugs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis shin tu mnyam par byas nas kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis shin tu mnyam par byas nas kun tu mi spyod pa'o //
translated: The unassailable is the path of cultivation, which is the complete non-performance of the afflictions, after having made them very even.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang rigs pas phyi'i yang dug la sogs pas mi tshugs shing mi nus par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang rigs pas phyi'i yang dug la sogs pas mi tshugs shing mi nus par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that the external, such as poison, is not able to assail it, because of reason.

original: de bzhin du bdud dang bdud kyi sde ni de'i 'khor te phyogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdud dang bdud kyi sde ni de'i 'khor te phyogs so //
translated: Likewise, the demon and the demon's army are its retinue, i.e., its side.

original: bdud kyi glags te nyes pa dang bug mi rnyed de /
analyzed: bdud kyi glags te nyes pa dang bug mi rnyed de /

original: gang gi skabs bzung bas kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi skabs bzung bas kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //

original: byed pa'i rjes la bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin pas de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: byed pa'i rjes la bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin pas de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa yang mos pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas @25b gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa yang mos pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas @25b gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the contaminated is threefold, by the division of the characteristics of the mental attentions of aspiration, dedication, and rejoicing.

original: zag pa med pa yang sgrub pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang sgrub pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The uncontaminated is also twofold, as accomplishment and purification.

original: de la dang po mos pa yid la byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni yang dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: de la dang po mos pa yid la byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni yang dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Among them, the first, the contaminated mental attention of aspiration, is the full accomplishment of virtuous dharmas.

original: gser gyi sgram  bu 'byung khungs nas thob pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin spyir ji lta ba bzhin du mos pas mthong ba'i dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang ldan pas dgos pa ma lus pa 'dus pa'i gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol
analyzed: gser gyi sgram  bu 'byung khungs nas thob pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin spyir ji lta ba bzhin du mos pas mthong ba'i dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa dang ldan pas dgos pa ma lus pa 'dus pa'i gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol
translated: Like gold obtained from the mine, it is the general nature of the complete view, and it is the mental attention of aspiration that sees it as it is. It is endowed with the object of virtuous dharmas that are seen. It is the principal accumulation of all that is necessary, the object of the perfection of wisdom,

original: tu phyin pa'i yul la mos pa dang / dri ba la sogs byed pa ni bsod nams mang po la sogs par bstan to //
analyzed: tu phyin pa'i yul la mos pa dang / dri ba la sogs byed pa ni bsod nams mang po la sogs par bstan to //
translated: the mental attention of aspiration, and the teaching of much merit, etc.

original: de yang rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang gsum las nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi bag chags ma spangs pa'i phyir rang gi don du mos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang gsum las nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi bag chags ma spangs pa'i phyir rang gi don du mos pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is from among the three kinds of aspirations, for one's own benefit, for one's own and others' benefit, and for others' benefit, that this is an aspiration for one's own benefit, because the instinct for pride, thinking I, has not been eliminated.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mchod rten la byed de /
translated: Stupas of the Tathagata's nirvana means made of the seven precious substances.üîΩSome sentient being means any sentient being.

analyzed: rim pa bzhin du rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin dpe gangg'a'i klung gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten bgyis shing 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba phrag stong bkang ste /
translated: In order, they make st≈´pas of the tathƒÅgatas out of the seven precious substances, like the Ganges river, and fill a thousand million world systems with them.

analyzed: des mchod rten byas nas mchod pa byed ces bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Having made those st≈´pas, they make offerings.

original: rim pa de bzhin du sems can ji snyed pas /
analyzed: rim pa de bzhin du sems can ji snyed pas /
translated: In that order, as many sentient beings as there are

original: zhing bye ba mtha' yas par yongs su rtag par bzung nas zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: zhing bye ba mtha' yas par yongs su rtag par bzung nas zhes bya bar 'brel to //

translated: generate interest

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyis don byed pa ni rnam 'dren te /
translated: The one who acts for the sake of the world in various forms is the Guide.

analyzed: bsod nams kyi yul gyi bye brag de bzhin du bstan to //

analyzed: mchod rten byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf one makes a st≈´pa,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du rang gi don 'dod pas mos pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i rjes la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi don du mos pa yin te /

analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir rgyal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThe Victors of the past, etc.‚Äù

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin no //

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: rkun ma'i 'jigs pa med do /
analyzed: rkun ma'i 'jigs pa med do /
translated: There is no fear of thieves.

original: gang gi phyir goms par byas nas 'di dag grong dang grong khyer gyi sngon gyi mtshan ma la ba lang rdzi la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms par byas nas 'di dag grong dang grong khyer gyi sngon gyi mtshan ma la ba lang rdzi la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Because, having become familiar with them, they see the signs of villages and cities, just as cowherds and so on do.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis mnyan pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis mnyan pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: When one listens to the perfection of wisdom, one is shown

original: sems dpa' la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sems dpa' la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: the bodhisattva and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba'i dus de'i tshe yang dag pa'i lam rnyed pas dbugs phyin par gyur cing theg pa'i bar chad kyi 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba'i dus de'i tshe yang dag pa'i lam rnyed pas dbugs phyin par gyur cing theg pa'i bar chad kyi 'jigs pa med do //
translated: When a bodhisattva seeks the Dharma that causes the attainment of enlightenment, at that time, having found the right path, he is relieved and has no fear of obstacles to the vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir yum mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa na dgra bcom sa la mi gnas rkyen rtogs kyi sa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yum mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa na dgra bcom sa la mi gnas rkyen rtogs kyi sa thob pa yin no //
translated: Because when the mother is fully applied to listening and so on, one attains the stage of realizing conditions, not the stage of arhatship.

analyzed: da ni yang yum mnyan pa la sogs pas phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ster bar byed pa bstan pa 'dir yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to show that the mother also grants all perfections such as listening, here it is said:

original: chos kyi sku thob par byed pa bstan pa'i sgo nas re zhig sbyor ba dpe sngon du 'gro bas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩmi zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob par byed pa bstan pa'i sgo nas re zhig sbyor ba dpe sngon du 'gro bas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / mi zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to make known through the teaching that grants the dharmakƒÅya, first the example is stated in order to make it understood:

analyzed: dper na mi zhig rgya mtsho'i chu ni blta phyir 'gro ba yis /
translated: It is like a person who goes to see the ocean.

original: gal te des shing dang nags tshal rir bcas pa mthong na da dung rgya mtsho chen po ni ring ngo zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te des shing dang nags tshal rir bcas pa mthong na da dung rgya mtsho chen po ni ring ngo zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If he sees trees, forests, and mountains, he should understand that the great ocean is still far away.

original: yang gang gi tshe ci ste shing la sogs pa'i rtags ma mthong na de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po ni nye bar gyur te /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe ci ste shing la sogs pa'i rtags ma mthong na de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po ni nye bar gyur te /
translated: But when he does not see any signs of trees, etc., then the great ocean is near.

original: shin tu mi ring ngo snyam du de la som nyi med de yid gnyis med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu mi ring ngo snyam du de la som nyi med de yid gnyis med par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should know that it is not very far away.

original: de ltar de bzhin du thos pa'i @37a * //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du thos pa'i @37a * //
translated: In the same way, one who listens to the mother

original: bsam pas byang chub dam par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pas byang chub dam par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that by the thought one has entered into the highest enlightenment.

original: rgyal ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyan pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is the indication of the Victor's perfection of wisdom,

original: sems pa dang / bsgom pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sems pa dang / bsgom pa yang yin no //
translated: which is listening, reflection, and meditation.üîΩThe Guide, the Lord,

original: rnam par 'dren pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis so //üîΩmngon sum du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par ma gyur kyang mnyan pa la sogs pa la nus pa thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas byang chub ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis so // mngon sum du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par ma gyur kyang mnyan pa la sogs pa la nus pa thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas byang chub ste /
translated: has declared the enlightenment of the Buddha,

original: chos kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the full realization of all dharmas.

original: ring por mi thogs bdag reg 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs bdag reg 'gyur ro //

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par bya ba bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par bya ba bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach by way of accomplishing the attainment of the enjoyment body,

original: dpyid dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpyid dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, in the spring season, etc.

original: dper na dpyid dus bzang la yal ga dang lo ma rnyings pa rnams lhags gyur na yal gas ring por mi thogs lo 'dab me tog 'bras bu rnams bskrun no //
analyzed: dper na dpyid dus bzang la yal ga dang lo ma rnyings pa rnams lhags gyur na yal gas ring por mi thogs lo 'dab me tog 'bras bu rnams bskrun no //
translated: For example, when the branches and leaves of a tree in the spring season wither, the branches will not be delayed in producing leaves, flowers, and fruit.

original: de bzhin du shes rab pha rol phyin 'di su'i lag tu thob pa na yun ring por mi thogs par des byang chub mchog tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'dir mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i stobs kyis 'dren pa rnams kyis 'thob po //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab pha rol phyin 'di su'i lag tu thob pa na yun ring por mi thogs par des byang chub mchog tu longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'dir mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i stobs kyis 'dren pa rnams kyis 'thob po //
translated: In the same way, when this perfection of wisdom comes into the hands of someone, the guides will attain the enjoyment body of supreme enlightenment in this world through the power of practice such as listening, without being delayed for a long time.

original: sprul pa'i sku thob par bya ba'i sgo yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku thob par bya ba'i sgo yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to also show the door for attaining the emanation body,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, for example,

original: dper na bud med na chung mngal skye ba ni sbrum ma'o //
analyzed: dper na bud med na chung mngal skye ba ni sbrum ma'o //
translated: for example, a young woman who is pregnant is one who is with child.

original: gang gi tshe de ni btsa' ba'i dus la bab ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ni btsa' ba'i dus la bab ces bya ba ste /
translated: When the time for giving birth has come,

analyzed: yan lag rnams rgyas pa ni dus la bab po //

original: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Feeling has the nature of experience.

original: de btsa' ba'i dus te skye ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de btsa' ba'i dus te skye ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the time of its birth is the time of its being born.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sngar mnyan nas sems pa na rgyal ba'i shes rab pha rol phyin pa la gong nas gong du dga' ba dang 'dun pa bskyed pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'dir mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas myur du byang chub mchog reg
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sngar mnyan nas sems pa na rgyal ba'i shes rab pha rol phyin pa la gong nas gong du dga' ba dang 'dun pa bskyed pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'dir mnyan pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas myur du byang chub mchog reg
translated: In the same way, when the bodhisattva, having previously listened, reflects, and sees the generation of ever higher joy and aspiration for the perfection of wisdom of the victors, at that time he will quickly reach supreme enlightenment here through the practice of listening, etc.

original: ste / sprul pa'i sku thob po //
analyzed: ste / sprul pa'i sku thob po //
translated: and will attain the emanation body.

original: yang mnyan pa la sogs pa'i blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i chos ji ltar blang ba dang / dor ba thob ce na /üîΩshes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩshes rab pha rol phyin mchog spyod tshe rnal 'byor pa nyan pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang mnyan pa la sogs pa'i blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i chos ji ltar blang ba dang / dor ba thob ce na / shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / shes rab pha rol phyin mchog spyod tshe rnal 'byor pa nyan pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, how does one attain the Dharma to be adopted and to be abandoned through listening, etc.?üîΩIt is said: ‚ÄúWhen practicing the supreme perfection of wisdom, the yogi does not see the increase of all phenomena such as form.‚Äù

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad de kho na nyid du 'phel ba ste skye ba mi mthong ba'o //
translated: When practicing the supreme perfection of wisdom, the yogi of listening, etc. does not see the increase, i.e. arising, of all phenomena such as form in reality.

original: yongs su 'grib pa med de 'jig pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med de 'jig pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: There is no decrease, no destruction is seen.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig chos dang chos min mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig chos dang chos min mi mthong zhing /
translated: Therefore, one who does not see dharma and adharma,

analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub la mi reg par gnas pa de ni sku gsum thob nas chos kyi dbyings kyi shes rab gnas so //
translated: Abiding without touching the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth, one attains the three bodies and abides in the wisdom of the realm of dharma.

analyzed: gang zhig 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: rgyal ba'i shes rab pha rol phyin 'di yig 'bri'i tshe ni gzhung gi don bri ba dang / yid la byed pa'o //
translated: When this perfection of wisdom of the Victorious Ones is being written, the meaning of the text is written and contemplated.

translated: Eloquence is the arising of many different kinds of special wisdom with regard to the object, and the non-accomplishment of the purpose of beings.

translated: Because it is not taught through analyzing the former and latter, and because it quickly deteriorates like a flash of lightning, this is indeed for the time being a work of Mara.

analyzed: 'di bshad tshe na kha cig som nyi za 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: When this is being taught, some will have doubts.

original: bshad pa ni bshad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni bshad par gyur pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the explanation that has occurred.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la the tshom za ba ni som nyir gyur pa'o //
translated: Having doubts about what is taught by the Buddha is having doubts.

original: des yongs su ma shes par 'dren pa bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir ni bdag gi ming yang ma brjod /
analyzed: des yongs su ma shes par 'dren pa bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir ni bdag gi ming yang ma brjod /
translated: Not fully understanding that, they think, The Leader, the Blessed One, has not mentioned my name here.

original: rigs dang sa dang rus kyang yongs su ma brjod ces /
analyzed: rigs dang sa dang rus kyang yongs su ma brjod ces /
translated: He has not fully mentioned my caste, stage of life, or clan.

original: de ni nyan par mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab yul la drag tu sgrub pa ni bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sngon du dad pa 'gro ba ma yin nam /

analyzed: lan du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i dpe sngon du 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says:

analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de thang la gnas par de ltar dad ldan dang ba tsam thob pa gang zhig gis ni shes rab pha rol tu phyin yum rjes su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de thang la gnas par de ltar dad ldan dang ba tsam thob pa gang zhig gis ni shes rab pha rol tu phyin yum rjes su mi 'jug ste /

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa ma spangs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgal dka' ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa ma spangs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgal dka' ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ste /

original: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: rga ba ni rnyings pa'o //

analyzed: rang gi rigs mthun pa'i rgyun chad pas na 'chi ba'o //

analyzed: de dag nyid rlabs te gang gi phyir de dag gi rim pa ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'o //

original: de la de skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de la de skad ces brjod de /
translated: It is called that,

original: de bas na sbyor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: therefore it is called connection.

original: gang zhig de yang dad pa stobs su gyur @42a * //
analyzed: gang zhig de yang dad pa stobs su gyur @42a * //
translated: Whoever, through the power of faith,

original: pas shes rab pha rol phyin mchog gis zin pa ste /
analyzed: pas shes rab pha rol phyin mchog gis zin pa ste /
translated: is endowed with the supreme perfection of wisdom,

original: dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na dad pa dang shes rab kyi stobs la sogs pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi nor kun rdzob tu yongs su rdzogs pa ni gru ste /

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rang bzhin de dag dang ldan pa la de skad brjod do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rang bzhin de dag dang ldan pa la de skad brjod do //
translated: One who possesses those, the nature of the stages of the Joyful One and so on, is so called.üîΩSince it is not the domain of the Sravakas and so on, it is supreme, wondrous, and one quickly reaches the enlightenment of the Sugatas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pas mchog tu rmad byung bde gshegs byang chub myur du reg / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid don du gnyer bas gnyis po rgyun mi 'chad par dmigs par bya'o zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //

translated: One should know that this teaches that one should continuously focus on the two, striving for the special characteristics.

analyzed: dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i dpes rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du res 'ga' byed pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de gnyis nyid thob pa ni khyad par can gyi gzhir gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir / dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The examples of object and non-object show that, respectively, one acts sometimes and one acts uninterruptedly. In order to remove the unfavorable and the antidote, the attainment of those two is taught as the basis for the special foundation that precedes.

original: dper na la las rdza so ma btang chu bskyed na //
analyzed: dper na la las rdza so ma btang chu bskyed na //
translated: For example, someone who fills a vessel with water that has not been fired

original: nyam chung phyir na myur du 'jig par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyam chung phyir na myur du 'jig par rig par bya ste /

original: chu bcu bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: chu bcu bar mi nus pa'o //

analyzed: so btang bum par chu bskyed lam du 'jig pa yi //

original: 'jigs pa med cing phyi ma la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med cing phyi ma la yang sbyar ro //

original: phyin par gyur pa ni bar chad kyi gnod pa med par gyur pas khyim du bde bar ro //
analyzed: phyin par gyur pa ni bar chad kyi gnod pa med par gyur pas khyim du bde bar ro //
translated: Having arrived, it is safe at home, because it is free from the harm of obstacles.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dad pa mang gyur kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dad pa mang gyur kyang /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva may have a lot of faith,

analyzed: shes rab rnam par nyams nas gnyis su ltung bas myur du ma rung 'gyur ro //
translated: Since wisdom is impaired, one falls into the two extremes, and quickly becomes unfit.

original: dad pa de nyid kyis shes rab kyi don ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su zin gyur na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa gnyis las shin tu 'das te byang chub mchog thob 'gyur /
analyzed: dad pa de nyid kyis shes rab kyi don ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su zin gyur na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa gnyis las shin tu 'das te byang chub mchog thob 'gyur /

analyzed: bum pa so ma btang ba dang btang bas mi thob pa dang / thob pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa dang rten du gyur pa bstan par 'gyur ro //

original: rten gzhan yang dad pa la sogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rten gzhan yang dad pa la sogs pa ma yin nam /

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis kho na gtsor bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis kho na gtsor bstan ce na /

original: lan @42b 'di dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan @42b 'di dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is stated beginning with ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na shing rnying pa dbyung ba la sogs pa'i bcos legs ma byas pa'i gru rgya mtsho chen por nor dang bcas par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na shing rnying pa dbyung ba la sogs pa'i bcos legs ma byas pa'i gru rgya mtsho chen por nor dang bcas par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a boat that has not been well repaired, such as by removing old wood, etc., will sink in the great ocean along with its wealth.

original: yang gru legs par bcos legs par byas pa dang / mthun pa'i rlung dang ldan par byas na mi 'jig nor dang bcas pa dogs su phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gru legs par bcos legs par byas pa dang / mthun pa'i rlung dang ldan par byas na mi 'jig nor dang bcas pa dogs su phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if a boat is well-constructed and well-maintained, and if it has a favorable wind, it will not be destroyed and will reach its destination with its cargo.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dad pas yongs bzung yang //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dad pas yongs bzung yang //
translated: In the same way, even if a bodhisattva is possessed of faith,

original: shes rab med na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab med na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: if he lacks wisdom, he will fall away from the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa de nyid yongs bsgoms pas shes rab pha rol phyin pa mchog ldan pa ni bzang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: But if the bodhisattva, possessed of that very faith, cultivates it, he will attain the supreme perfection of wisdom and will be well-endowed.

original: de nyams shing gzhan du ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyams shing gzhan du ltung bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: ma rmas ma nyams par de yang rang gi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid rgyal ba rnams kyi byang chub mchog la reg par 'gyur te /
translated: Without being damaged or destroyed, he will touch the supreme enlightenment of the victors, suchness, because he has correctly embarked upon his own vehicle.

analyzed: gnyis po kho nas grub pas ma tshang ba med pa yin pa shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he is complete, since he is established in those two alone.

original: zag lhan byas pa dang ma byas pa'i grus 'grub pa dang mi 'grub pa dang / tshang ba dang ma tshang ba shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zag lhan byas pa dang ma byas pa'i grus 'grub pa dang mi 'grub pa dang / tshang ba dang ma tshang ba shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the establishment and non-establishment of the two, the contaminated and the uncontaminated, in terms of being done and not done, and in terms of being complete and incomplete,

analyzed: de gnyis kho na yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is taught that just those two should be taken as the basis.

original: lo brgya zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
analyzed: lo brgya zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: dper na skyes bu gang zhig rgas shing gnyer ma dang ldan pas 'khogs pa zas la sogs pa dang mi ldan pas sdug bsngal ba lo brgya dang nyi shu lon pas gang gi yang ji srid na stan las langs kyang /üîΩde bzhin du yang rang gis rgyang grags phyed dam /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang zhig rgas shing gnyer ma dang ldan pas 'khogs pa zas la sogs pa dang mi ldan pas sdug bsngal ba lo brgya dang nyi shu lon pas gang gi yang ji srid na stan las langs kyang / de bzhin du yang rang gis rgyang grags phyed dam /
translated: For example, a person who is old and wrinkled, who is decrepit, who is suffering from not having food and so forth, who is one hundred and twenty years old, who, when he gets up from his seat,üîΩin the same way, he is not able to go even half a kro≈õa or one kro≈õa by himself,

original: rgyang grags su grogs med par nus pa med pa'i phyir 'gro bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyang grags su grogs med par nus pa med pa'i phyir 'gro bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: because he is not able to do so without a companion.

original: de ni g-yas g-yon gnyis kyi lag pa gnyis mi dag gis brten byas par gyur na de'i tshe 'gyel ba'i 'jigs pa med cing ji srid du 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas su bde blag tu phyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni g-yas g-yon gnyis kyi lag pa gnyis mi dag gis brten byas par gyur na de'i tshe 'gyel ba'i 'jigs pa med cing ji srid du 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas su bde blag tu phyin par 'gyur /
translated: When it is supported by two men on the right and the left, then it has no fear of falling and it easily reaches the place to which it is going.

original: de bzhin byang chub sems dpa' shes rab la 'di ltar rmongs pas stobs chung ba gang gi tshe yang dad pa tsam gyis zhugs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin byang chub sems dpa' shes rab la 'di ltar rmongs pas stobs chung ba gang gi tshe yang dad pa tsam gyis zhugs par gyur kyang /
translated: In the same way, when the bodhisattva, weak through ignorance of wisdom, has entered into the state of faith,
