analyzed: 'di ltar yang chos nyid kyis ma bzung zhing bral na nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba'i bar thob pas nyams par 'gyur te 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: if he is not held by the Dharma itself, he will fall and be lost, even up to the level of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab mchog gis yong zin na //
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab mchog gis yong zin na //
translated: But when he is seized by the supreme method and wisdom,

original: mi nyams te de @43a * //
analyzed: mi nyams te de @43a * //
translated: he does not fall.

original: bzhin gshegs kyi ste /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs kyi ste /
translated: He is like the TathƒÅgata.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtogs nas mi'i drang srong bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtogs nas mi'i drang srong bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having realized the characteristic of distinction, he touches the awakening of the Blessed One, the human sage.

original: des na skyes bu rgas pa brten pa dang ma brten pa'i dpes shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang / ma bzung ba dag ci rigs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba dang / mi ltung ba dag bsal bar byas pas bstan pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na skyes bu rgas pa brten pa dang ma brten pa'i dpes shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang / ma bzung ba dag ci rigs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba dang / mi ltung ba dag bsal bar byas pas bstan pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand the meaning of the teaching by the examples of the old man who is supported and who is not supported, respectively, those who are and are not sustained by the skill in means and wisdom, respectively, those who fall into cyclic existence and nirvana and those who do not fall into cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las dpe'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las dpe'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the explanation of the fourteenth chapter of the root tantra, the chapter on the examples, from the Tantra of the Condensed Essence of the Great Expanse.üîΩThe chapter on the examplesüîΩThe chapter on the examples

original: // / ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas khyad par gyi lam thob nas dmigs pa'i ro myang ba med par dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas khyad par gyi lam thob nas dmigs pa'i ro myang ba med par dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having attained the special path in the stages as taught, one does not engage in what should not be done by the power of the spiritual friend without relishing the taste of the object.üîΩIn order to teach this, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang po'i las can ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la zhugs pa'i phyir dang po'i las te sar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang po'i las can ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la zhugs pa'i phyir dang po'i las te sar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is a beginner is one who is engaged in the characteristics of the distinctive stages, and is a beginner who is on the stages.

original: dge ba 'dod pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba 'dod pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: He has a superior attitude because he desires virtue.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs pa bla ma'i skyon mi 'dzin pa'i phyir slob ma bzang po de cher gus pas bla ma la gus ldan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs pa bla ma'i skyon mi 'dzin pa'i phyir slob ma bzang po de cher gus pas bla ma la gus ldan no //
translated: He is devoted to the guru because he is a good student who does not seize upon the guru's faults.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dus thams cad du bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dus thams cad du bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: He is to be known as one who has always served the spiritual friend with respect and so forth.

original: sems srung ba shes pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sems srung ba shes pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is wise because he knows how to protect the mind.

original: ci'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one rely upon the spiritual friend?

original: lan du mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response, he says, the wise one, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen de rnams las khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen de rnams las khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because from those spiritual friends the qualities of the distinctive characteristics arise.

original: des gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pas slob ma dmigs pa'i ro myang ba med pas mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: des gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pas slob ma dmigs pa'i ro myang ba med pas mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is a teacher because he teaches the disciples the instructions and follow-up teachings, without relishing the taste of meditative object.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su ston /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su ston /
translated: Those spiritual friends teach the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas chos rnams ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas chos rnams ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the qualities of the Buddha have the nature of distinctive characteristics.

original: sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir yon tan gyi mchog dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to zhes rgyal ba de skad gsung ngo //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir yon tan gyi mchog dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to zhes rgyal ba de skad gsung ngo //
translated: In order to abandon all obscurations, one should rely on the spiritual friends who are supreme in qualities. The Victorious One has said this.

original: de bas na de bsnyen bkur bya ba yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de bsnyen bkur bya ba yin par dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that one should serve them.

original: de dag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i 'dra ba zhig @43b ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i 'dra ba zhig @43b ce na /
translated: What is similar about their instructions and follow-up teachings?

original: sbyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, Generosity... and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la zhugs te /
translated: One should engage in the non-apprehension of the nature that subsumes all phenomena such as generosity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams las byed pa po dang bya ba mi dmigs pas yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams las byed pa po dang bya ba mi dmigs pas yin te /
translated: Because the six perfections are not perceived as agents or actions.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir sa dang po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ro myang ba spangs nas byang chub kyi rgyur yongs su bsngo bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir sa dang po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i ro myang ba spangs nas byang chub kyi rgyur yongs su bsngo bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the relishing of the object of the first stage and so on, you should dedicate to enlightenment.

original: byang chub phung po ni zag pa med pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa dpyad nas phyis rnam par dpyad pas nges pa na 'dzin par ma byed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub phung po ni zag pa med pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa dpyad nas phyis rnam par dpyad pas nges pa na 'dzin par ma byed ce na /
translated: The aggregates of enlightenment are established by the reasoning of the aggregates of morality and so on, which are the uncontaminated results. After analyzing them, later, when you are certain through analysis, do not grasp them.

original: dang po'i las can de dag la rig pas nges par sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i phyir dang po rab tu sbyor ba bstan pa de skad bstan par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: dang po'i las can de dag la rig pas nges par sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i phyir dang po rab tu sbyor ba bstan pa de skad bstan par bya ba nyid do //
translated: For beginners, it is taught that they should first apply themselves to the realization of illusion-like understanding through reasoning. That is how it should be taught.

original: gzhan du na dad pa tsam yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dad pa tsam yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would have no faith at all.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa shes pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa shes pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the defining characteristic of the special knowledge of the abundant benefit for self and others,

original: mjug thogs su gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba rnams kyi phan pa la sogs pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug thogs su gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la sbyor ba rnams kyi phan pa la sogs pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: immediately following that, in order to teach the defining characteristic of the benefit, etc. of those who are engaged in the abundant benefit for others,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, thus, etc.

original: de ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes nas sbyor ba rnams bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i chos bstan pas ma 'ongs pa'i bden pa thob pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes nas sbyor ba rnams bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i chos bstan pas ma 'ongs pa'i bden pa thob pa ni yon tan no //
translated: Having fully understood the defining characteristic of that knowledge, the benefit of the practice is the attainment of the truth of the future, through the power of meditation on the teaching of the bodhisattva practice.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The collection of qualities is an ocean, because it is difficult to understand.

original: da ltar byung ba'i bde ba thob pas dga' ba'i phyir smra ba'i zla ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i bde ba thob pas dga' ba'i phyir smra ba'i zla ba'o //
translated: It is the moon of speech, because it is delightful through the attainment of the present happiness.

original: yang dag par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir don byed pas na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi skyabs so //
analyzed: yang dag par smin par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir don byed pas na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi skyabs so //
translated: It is a refuge for the world of sentient beings because it is the basis for the performance of benefit, since it is the basis for the establishment of the reality of sentient beings who are not yet matured.

original: de bzhin du shin tu phan pa kun nas 'byung ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir dpung gnyen no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu phan pa kun nas 'byung ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir dpung gnyen no //
translated: It is a protector because it is the basis for the arising of great benefit.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sel ba'i don gyi rten du 'jug pa'i phyir gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sel ba'i don gyi rten du 'jug pa'i phyir gnas so //
translated: It is a support because it is the basis for the removal of the cause of suffering.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam par rtogs par khyad par du 'gro bas sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten dang blo'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam par rtogs par khyad par du 'gro bas sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten dang blo'o //
translated: It is a basis and a support because it is the cause of Buddhahood, since it is the special realization of the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: chu spangs nas dam pa'i chos kyi skam sa mtha' gnyis spangs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don thob pa'i rten du gyur pa ster bas gling ngo //üîΩsna 'dren par gyur pas gzhan gyi don rab tu @44a * //
analyzed: chu spangs nas dam pa'i chos kyi skam sa mtha' gnyis spangs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don thob pa'i rten du gyur pa ster bas gling ngo // sna 'dren par gyur pas gzhan gyi don rab tu @44a * //
translated: It is an island because it is the basis for the attainment of the goal of self and other, since it is the dry land of the holy Dharma, free from the two extremes, and it grants freedom from the flood of samsara.

original: bskyed pa'i phyir yongs su 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i phyir yongs su 'dren pa'o //
translated: It is a guide because it is the basis for the generation of the welfare of others.üîΩIt is a leader because it is the basis for the generation of the welfare of others.

original: sems can gyi don la mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nye bar sdud pa'i phyir don 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nye bar sdud pa'i phyir don 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for the goal, because it is the collection of the perfections that are the means of attaining the goal, the nonconceptual and spontaneous engagement in the aims of sentient beings.

original: theg pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba yang mngon sum du mi byed cing byang chub kyi lam gsal bar byed pas na gsal byed sgron ma'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba yang mngon sum du mi byed cing byang chub kyi lam gsal bar byed pas na gsal byed sgron ma'o //
translated: It is the lamp of clear light, because it is the clear light of the path to enlightenment, without manifesting the deliverance of all vehicles.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid gtam gyi gzhi dang sgo yin pa'i phyir chos mchog smra ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid gtam gyi gzhi dang sgo yin pa'i phyir chos mchog smra ba'o //
translated: It is the supreme Dharma, because it is the basis and the door to the reality of all dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas 'khrugs par mi nus pas na mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas 'khrugs par mi nus pas na mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: It is the unshakable, because it cannot be disturbed by demons, tirthikas, and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni bya ba yin pas gang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas ci 'dra ba'i bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni bya ba yin pas gang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas ci 'dra ba'i bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir
translated: The function is the accomplishment of one's own and others' goals. Therefore, the nature of that is taught, and the teaching of its own characteristics is preceded by the teaching of its nature, which is the accomplishment of such a nature.

original: / grags chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / grags chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúgreat fame‚Äù teaches the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid che ba thob pa'i phyir grags chen ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid che ba thob pa'i phyir grags chen ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with great fame because he has attained greatness.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i phyir bya dga' ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i phyir bya dga' ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: He is devoted to the practice of delighting in suffering.

original: 'bad pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir go cha'o //
analyzed: 'bad pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir go cha'o //
translated: The armor is the practice of the perfections.

original: gang bsgom par brtson pa ni go cha gyon byed do //
analyzed: gang bsgom par brtson pa ni go cha gyon byed do //
translated: He who strives to cultivate the perfections is one who dons the armor.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa med pas phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad rnams kyi go cha yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa med pas phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad rnams kyi go cha yin te /
translated: The armor of the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements is due to the non-apprehension of their resistance.

original: gnyen por mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa theg pa gsum 'du shes bral lo //
analyzed: gnyen por mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa theg pa gsum 'du shes bral lo //
translated: The armor of the three vehicles, the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna, etc., is due to the absence of the notion of an antidote.

original: yang de lta bas na dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su gzung ba med do //
analyzed: yang de lta bas na dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su gzung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, he is without appropriation, because he is free from grasping at the dharmas to be rejected and accepted.

original: rang gi don phun sum chags pa las ldog pa med pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum chags pa las ldog pa med pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: It is irreversible because it is not turned away from the perfection of one's own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa las mi g-yo ba'i phyir g-yo ba med cing ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa las mi g-yo ba'i phyir g-yo ba med cing ngo //
translated: It is unmoving because it is not moved from the perfection of others' aims.

original: gnyi ga'i don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta ba byed pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir mi 'khrugs chos can no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don phun sum tshogs pa ji lta ba byed pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir mi 'khrugs chos can no //
translated: It is unperturbed because it is never separated from the performance of the perfection of both aims.üîΩWhat is its nature?

original: rang bzhin ji lta bu la sbyor zhe na /üîΩde dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta bu la sbyor zhe na / de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says,

original: de dag 'di 'dra ni ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'di 'dra ni ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are like this.

original: sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni chos nyid ldan no //
analyzed: sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni chos nyid ldan no //
translated: It is endowed with reality because it has the nature of the abandonment of addictions, etc. by the power of the cultivation of the application.

original: rnam par mi rtogs pa'i ye shes thob pas na spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtogs pa'i ye shes thob pas na spros pa med pa'o //
translated: It is free from conceptual elaboration because it has attained the non-conceptual intuition.

original: the tshom dang / @44b brdzun dang / phyin ci log spangs pas the tshom yid gnyis bral lo //
analyzed: the tshom dang / @44b brdzun dang / phyin ci log spangs pas the tshom yid gnyis bral lo //
translated: It is free from doubt and uncertainty because it has abandoned doubt, falsehood, and error.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ldan pa'i phyir don ldan no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ldan pa'i phyir don ldan no //
translated: It is meaningful because it is endowed with right knowledge.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa thos nas te /
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa thos nas te /
translated: Having heard the perfection of wisdom,

original: rtogs pa thob pa nas mi nur ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pa nas mi nur ba'o //
translated: from the attainment of understanding, there is no turning back.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing rang gi sa las ldog pa med pas ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing rang gi sa las ldog pa med pas ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know that one does not fall back from one's own stage, because one is not led by others.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas par gyur pa spangs nas rnam pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin cung zad kyang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas par gyur pa spangs nas rnam pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin cung zad kyang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who has become like that does not manifest even the slightest nature of any aspect, having abandoned the state of the Sugata,üîΩit is said,

original: 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Leader and so on.

original: chos 'di dag gi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir zab ste rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis mthong bar dka' ba bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: chos 'di dag gi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir zab ste rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis mthong bar dka' ba bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Because the nature of these phenomena is like an illusion, they are profound, difficult to realize, and therefore difficult to see. The Blessed One is connected with this.

original: gzhan sus kyang ste nyan thos la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa med pas cung zad thob pa yang med cing /
analyzed: gzhan sus kyang ste nyan thos la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa med pas cung zad thob pa yang med cing /
translated: No one else, that is, no Hearer and so on, has attained even the slightest bit, because they do not realize all aspects.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no attainment.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar sems can gyi don gtsor mdzad pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid zhar la brnyes pas na byang chub brnyes kyang sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pas na phan mdzad brtser ldan te bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar sems can gyi don gtsor mdzad pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid zhar la brnyes pas na byang chub brnyes kyang sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pas na phan mdzad brtser ldan te bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Thus, the TathƒÅgata himself is attained incidentally by one who is intent on the welfare of sentient beings. Therefore, even though he has attained enlightenment, he is the compassionate benefactor of all sentient beings.

original: sbyor ba'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i grol ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i grol ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical that there be liberation apart from the intrinsic reality of the essence of practice.

original: sems can gyi tshogs sus kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis chos bstan pa 'di mi shes te /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs sus kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis chos bstan pa 'di mi shes te /
translated: No one in the multitude of sentient beings knows this teaching of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag ni dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems can gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba la thugs khral chung bar mdzad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag ni dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems can gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba la thugs khral chung bar mdzad de /
translated: Nevertheless, he is not concerned about the difficulty of engaging in the welfare of sentient beings, thinking, ‚ÄúThese are attached to the perception of objects.‚Äù

original: de / de bas na chos bstan pa'i thugs ma 'khrungs pa de lta bu yang tshangs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: de / de bas na chos bstan pa'i thugs ma 'khrungs pa de lta bu yang tshangs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even that non-arising of the thought to teach the Dharma was the Brahma's request for the wheel of the Dharma to be turned.

original: de lta mod kyi sems can gyi chos ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sems can gyi chos ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
translated: However, what kind of Dharma do sentient beings possess?

original: sems can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said sentient beings... and so on.

original: gang gi tshe yang sems can rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gzhi la mngon par zhen pa ste nyes par mi lta bas na dga' zhing ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang sems can rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gzhi la mngon par zhen pa ste nyes par mi lta bas na dga' zhing ngo //
translated: When sentient beings are attached to the basis of desire and so on, they do not see faults, and so they delight in and enjoy them.

original: yul rnams 'dod pa ni de la yon tan du lta ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mi spong bas 'dzin pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnams 'dod pa ni de la yon tan du lta ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mi spong bas 'dzin pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: They desire objects, and because they see them as having good qualities, they do not abandon mental activity, and so they abide in grasping.

original: mi shes pa dang ldan pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang ldan pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: Because they possess ignorance, they are unwise.

original: the tshom gyi shes pa yod pas na blun rmongs pa'o //üîΩlog @45a * //
analyzed: the tshom gyi shes pa yod pas na blun rmongs pa'o // log @45a * //
translated: Because they have the knowledge of doubt, they are foolish and confused.

original: pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mun pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they possess wrong knowledge, they are like darkness.

original: 'di ltar yang ngo bo nyid kyi chos rtogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnas med cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang ngo bo nyid kyi chos rtogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnas med cing /
translated: Thus, since the realization of a nature that is a phenomenon is the antidote to attachment and so on, it is without basis.
